body.p: The Trustees shall develop rules and procedures to ensure that the IASB is, and is seen to be, independent, and, in particular, on appointment, full-time members of the IASB shall sever all employment relationships with current employers and shall not hold any position giving rise to economic incentives that might call into question their independence of judgement in setting IFRS Accounting Standards. Secondments and any rights to return to an employer would, therefore, not be permitted. Part-time members of the IASB would not be expected to sever all other employment arrangements but must be able to demonstrate and maintain a sufficient level of independence.
